results.title: Himalayan lakes
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, Films Division, Government of India and Gopal Datt
results.brief_description: The beauty of the large lakes in the foothills region of the Himalayan Mountains, mecca of climbers and tourists from India and overseas. Includes many attractions in the numerous valleys - shrines, fast moving mountain streams and rushing rivers, Indian villages and house boats in all seasons of the year.

results.title: Himalaya: life on the roof of the world
results.brief_description: Discusses the relative position, importance and size of the Himalayas, their geological history and the origin of the monsoon rains and how the rivers from the roof of the world have built the valleys and civilizations of Asia. Customs and ways of living have not changed much and all the canyons share in a common Indian culture. Also the pervading influence of Tibet are shown in three simple canyon civilizations: Buddhist Sikkim, Hindu Ganges Canyon and Islamic Kashmir.

results.title: Himachal
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Films Division, Government of India and N.S. Thapa
results.brief_description: A portrait of Himachal Pradesh State and its progress in recent years. Snowbound in winter the valleys awake in spring, when the sheep are shorn for their fine carpet wools, and the crops are planted. Isolation which has held back the development of Himachal Pradesh is being broken down by the building of the Hindustan Tibet highway. Life of the village people Mandi, where pilgrims flock to the ancient temple; traditions of religion, art and folkdance; orchards, timber and potatoes as increasing valuable products; snow sports in winter.

results.title: Highways in action
results.brief_description: Planning and execution of modern roads and bridges in Japan, showing advanced methods to cope with heavy urban traffic in Tokyo and designs for open country where appearance as part of the landscape is as important as function.

results.title: Highways challenge
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Jack Gardiner
results.brief_description: This film deals with Australia’s road problems. Describes how each member of the public is dependent upon road transport and points out that poor roads increase prices. Shows how cheaper methods of road transport can eventually be more costly. Suggests that the correct approach to the problem is lacking and offers a solution. Commentary by David Low.

results.brief_description: Details of planning and improvements of Victorian state highways, including climbing lanes for slow traffic, duplicate pavements, elimination of railroad crossings and development of by-pass roads.

results.title: Highlights of the United Nations year 1947-48
results.brief_description: UNO’s activities during 1947-48 included: partition of Palestine; building a headquarters for UNO; combating a cholera outbreak in Egypt; sending wool from Australia to Poland; attending the funeral of Mahatma Ghandi; Mutual Aid Conference in India; truce in Indonesia; sending 2,500 displaced persons to Venezuela under IRO sponsorship; launching the International Children’s Emergency Fund plans to send 140 million pounds worth of food and clothing and medical supplies for use in Asia and Europe.

results.title: Highlights Edinburgh 1986 Commonwealth Games
results.brief_description: Ten days of vivid emotion, colour and competition are captured on this specially compiled video containing highlights of the X111th Commonwealth Games held in Edinburgh, Scotland. All ten sports are featured and there are many memorable moments as athletes achieve long hoped for success or experience the pain of defeat.
